s.text: Interestingly, mice lacking ?-gustducin are compromised in the detection of sweet compounds as well as bitter compounds, suggesting that sweet receptors may also couple to ?-gustducin [ 10].
Other studies, however, suggested that a decrease in cAMP, rather than an increase in IP 3 , mediated bitter transduction.

Blocking solution contained 0.3% Triton X-100, 1% normal goat serum, and 1% bovine serum albumin in 0.1 M PBS.
Alpha-gustducin activates PDE to decrease intracellular levels of cAMP [ 13], while its ?? partners stimulate PLC?2 to produce IP 3 and DAG [ 18].

Interestingly, G?i-2, another alpha subunit heavily expressed in taste cells [ 26], also functions to decrease intracellular levels of cAMP and may lead to regulation of IP 3 R3.
Primarily intragemmal taste cells were labeled, proliferative basal cells of the taste buds did not appear to be labeled.
IP 3 R3 appears to be located throughout the cytoplasm of taste cells, consistent with its expected location on the smooth endoplasmic membrane [ 21].
In addition, gustatory nerve fibers did not appear to be labeled.
However, some taste cells appeared to differ in the degree of labeling for each antibody, with some cells showing more intense label for IP 3 R3 and others for PLC?2.
